Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
CAN: Draw a generic plant shape, though details may be missing or simplistic (e.g., a stick with a circular top to represent the plant).
Attempt to use colors to represent the plant, but may not accurately reflect health (e.g., using one color for all plants).
CANNOT: Accurately demonstrate the effects of plenty of water and light on a plant (e.g., plant is shown the same regardless of conditions).
Illustrate a wilted plant due to lack of water (e.g., plant still looks the same, the concept of wilting is unclear).
Illustrate a wilted plant due to lack of light (e.g., no visual difference between plants in light and dark conditions).
Differentiate between plants with and without water (e.g., inability to show drooping leaves).
Differentiate between plants with and without light (e.g., confusion about what changes occur without light, such as color changes).
